--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0264 b) Date of Occurrence: 11/10/2023
c) Installation Details: Atlas Cargo - AC-3723-174 at
Maintenance Hub-X
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Avionics b) Date Component 18/10/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Radar System d) Main Assembly: Pylon-D
e) Nomenclature: Radar System Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Standard
g) Part No.: AV-9196-G6 h) Sl No.: SN-2173-864
i) Firmware Version: FW-4.23.217 j) Software Version: SW-7.74.84
k) Date of Installation: 12/10/2022 l) Date of Removal: 17/10/2023
Pg No: 31 Ln No: 3 Pg No: 82 Ln No: 8
m) Manufacturing Agency: Skyward Defense Systems n) Date, Month & Year February 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2767 Hrs / 1122 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Electronic warfare system false alerts. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Environmental exposure causing accelerated degradation of protective coatings
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Radar System component. Inspection
revealed damage to critical components.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct detailed inspection of all similar components in fleet
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Update technical documentation with lessons learned
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design review completed. No design modification required. Component replacement as per maintenance manual is adequate.
Date: 05/11/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. P.L. Mehta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 08/11/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 07/11/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 08/11/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound.
Date: 15/11/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
